result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Everett Rinde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle Everett Rinde is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle Everett Rinde was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Kyle Everett Rinde was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge. miscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Follow all recommended programming as directed by Agent.
-Defendant to participate in MRT.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Michael Wink, Jordan Wink, Matthew Hayes, Madison Koepke, Kenneth Bierl or Samantha Gillis.
-Random and regular testing.
-Continue with mental health treatment.
-Defendant to maintain employment.
-Defendant to provide a DNA Sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Stephen J. Dunlap   DF:  Kyle Everett Rinde appeared from jail.  Includes  14CF100, 14CF122, 14CF214, 14CF312, 14CF324, 14CT82, 14TR1221 and 14TR1222. Case called at 11:12. ADA Nieskes makes statement as to plea agreement and requests a PSI. Atty. Dunlap agrees to plea agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 14CF100. DE pleads G in amended count 1 misdemeanor theft in 14CF312 and count 2. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct G to Ct 1 in 14CF100. Counts 2 and 3 are read in and dismissed. In 14CF312 to the amended Ct 1 misdemeanor theft and count 2 court finds DE G. Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed.  On motion of the State, Crt  dismisses 14CF312. 14CF214 is dismissed. In 14CF312 cound 3 and 4 are dismissed. 14CF324 and 14CF122 is dismissed. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: PSI 

Atty. Dunlap requests bond to be amended. ADA Nieskes does not agree. 
Court will grant furlough for DE  to get assessment and then be brought back to jail once DE mother is feeling better. DE to be in mothers custody of time of furlough.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

- Report to St. Croix County jail every Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.  Testing can be done at the discretion of the court upon reasonable suspicion.  

- If DE is in an inpatient treatment facility DE is exempt from testing.

- DE is to have contact with probation agent as directed by the agent.

- Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Preliminary hearing on August 14, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Kenneth B. or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
